caption: This place was highly recommended by a coworker so I was excited to try it. None of the plates were bad, some were actually pretty tasty but overall I would say it was “average”.  The Takoyaki was tasty. The shell was tasty, tasted like it was fried perhaps and had a good chunk of octopus in the middle. Tasty but missing ginger perhaps?  The gyoza was really good. Crispy and full of flavor, just how I like it! This might have been the highlight of the meal.  The tatsuta age was fresh and juicy with a good batter on it. The only complaint was that it was missing maybe a little salt? The taste was good but just a tad too bland.  The tonkatsu curry was pretty tasty. The pork slices were nicely breaded and thick and not dry. The curry itself tasted good too. This was perhaps my second favorite dish when I went.  Lastly, the ramen. The ramen was pretty tasty and the pork was cooked very well with a lot of flavor. The noodles were a little firmer then my personal preference but that is all on me since I like them pretty soft.  Lastly the ambiance and service. The place looked a little shabbier then the photos so maybe they are in the middle of some renovation during the pandemic. It wasn’t bad but the pictures on Google maps do look a bit cozier and nicer.  The service, was actually pretty good considering it is just the one guy there. He was attentive and nice and I did not get impatient.

I’ll give this place three stars, but I won’t return. Not because the food was bad, but since I’m in Sunnyside Queens, it’s kind of far. The appetizers were good. We ordered takoyaki, gyoza, fried oysters, fried chicken, katsu curry and ramen. The ramen was the only thing I didn’t care for. My Tokyo shouyu broth was on the salty side for me personally. The noodles were nice and firm. The half egg taster a bit sour. If the broth wasn’t salty I would of enjoyed it more. But the highlight was their katsu curry. Nice subtle heat in the curry and the pork was nicely fried.
The chicken fries are so bomb! Just like my mom makes it
One man operation. Authentic Contemporary Japanese flavors. Made the order, over the phone and food was ready for pick up. Tasty, hit the spot. Quality Take out Food for COVID19 Era...
This place is pretty small and easy to miss but is REALLY good

This is the best sushi I have had in a while. No chance to try their ramen, yet! But he is a great chef, high quality fish and you can tell every dish is made with care. Anyone who can order from here is lucky! Hope to dine in when that reopens.

Do yourself a favor and order food from this incredible man! Anyone living within delivery/pickup range of this place is insanely lucky. We'll be back. There's something really special about the food here - it's made with love and care, and that comes through. Simply delicious.
They offer a fantastic variety of delicious food. I enjoyed dining here. Employees are always super nice, pricing is fair and the spot is always clean.

Phenomenal restaurant. Rare and special experience to have dining in NYC. All the dishes made to order and brought to the table by the chef himself. Best seaweed broth veggie ramen in NYC. Hands down. Try the apps too : )
Amazing food and a superstar owner! Runs the place all by himself, 10/10
The food is regularly fresh and yummy, workers gives great customer service. I love how clean it is and mood. Will come visit again.
Amazing food!!!

Salmon belly is actually too good! Love the vibe here and the food so much!  Sometimes when busy because it's only one person it can take a long time but it doesn't matter because the food is sooo good!
This restaurant provides amazing service as well as delicious meals. My favourite restaurant in the area. The food and drinks served rapidly and the prices were economical. Recommended.
perfect

Amazing food! Everything is fresh and done right. Small place but perfect. Atmosphere is wonderful. The chef is fantastic and really knows what he's doing. When a menu is on the smaller side, you know it's a good restaurant; there is confidence behind it. We are very lucky to live so close and it is our go to spot for Japanese cuisine.
Best authentic Japanese food you can get in Brooklyn.   Be prepared to wait a little bit it is absolutely worth a wait.

Been meaning to try this place for a while and it doesn't disappoint. Tonkotsu ramen is the best I've had in the area and the salmon belly sashimi was really delicate and delicious. Great vibe from the chef watching him do his thing. He's obviously great at his profession and been doing it for a while. Will definitely recommend and come again!!
Vegetable curry  and spring rolls are delicious— the house dry sake is great too

Everyone knows it's slow and only one person does EVERYTHING!  So go when it's dead. Sushi was disappointing as pieces were small. Ramen was great tho. The guy who runs it didn't say a single word to us, so don't expect good service.
This place knows how to please their clients. Regularly with a helpful approach. The food is fairly priced, constantly flavorful and neat.

horrible experience, we were there at 6pm when the restaurant opened and was turned away, no apology, no explanation, wasn't sure if he didnt like us since we were chinese or didnt want to serve us since our group was too big for his liking. no one else at the restaurant since it just opened, I mean it was empty...

Delicious food and charming spot. The owner deserves much more recognition than I can provide in this post. I loved it, and highly recommend to others. We had sashimi appetizer and ramen - all fantastic.
The most authentic sushi in the neighborhood. If you want REAL, traditional, Japanese-level sushi, this is the only place to go. It's worth the price! The man knows what he is doing.
Favorite place to go for poke bowls in Brooklyn. Absolutely delicious !!

This place does a lot of things right—the atmosphere is very relaxed, which is helped by the jazz playing throughout. This type of high quality food doesn’t come quickly, but this fact works in your favor. Everything I’ve ever had has been thoughtfully prepared by the one owner, and the pace of service allows for a quality conversation with your dining partner. The ramen has great depth of flavor, the “addictive cucumber” is a super fresh umami bomb, and all of the fried appetizers are perfectly crisp and flavorful. I am very grateful that I happen to live near this place and I would likely travel for it even if I didn’t.

Owner/chef was so friendly- had a great bowl of veggie ramen. Menu does not have your typical sushi rolls, but more traditional service of sashimi. Would recommend this cute spot and head over on an off time if you’re the impatient type;)
Such a great place!! So happy with the entire experience.
Best Ramen ever. The whole place is operated by one man - the Chef itself. So things might take time, but totally worth it! Amazing food and great vibes!

Not really tasty. Very homey food. The ramen was below average. Salty but no depth of flavor. Sake was alright, but not the best I’ve had by far. I was amazed that the owner was doing everything himself. He should definitely hire at least someone to help himself out.  If you’re picking this place instead of Ichiran, the taste isn’t comparable, but it is much cheaper here.
Wonderful, very traditional Japanese - everything I’ve had is delicious. Expect a long wait as it is a one man show.

Mellow atmosphere with a cool vibe. The owner seems to be doing it all alone so it’s nice to see a hands on owner but also can be a down fall for when it gets busy. Seating is nice but not a lot of places for big groups. The ramen was super good! Lots of flavor with a perfectly cooked egg. I would definitely recommend this place for people to try.

This place has rapidly become one of my favorite restaurants in New York. The owner both works front of house and cooks, so it’s not the fastest experience, but the food is amazing! The addictive cucumber is so good that I could eat it for every meal, and nothing I’ve tried has ever been a disappointment.
Japanese owned, one man show. Loved the ramen curry and sushi. A lovely treasure in buswick. I highly recommend! He is open for lunch too! Will be coming back again.
Gem..!
Amazing, authentic Japanese food, best in neighborhood!!
My favourite local spot. One man show so be patient but by far the best ramen in Bushwick. The sushi and all other dishes are wonderful too.
Great food, nice atmosphere. Laid back and not showy. Chef really knows what he is doing. Nice guy.

Super quaint ramen spot. I really love ramen and I can say this spot met my expectations. Service was on point as well. No complaints what so ever. I came in on a nippy winter Saturday afternoon and got the Tonsokoto Ramen and was totally satisfied with flavors and texture of ramen noodles. Definitely will come here again if I'm ever on this side of town.

Ajihei is a cute and cozy one-man show—the same man serves, cooks, cleans, and tends bar. Prices are reasonable and the food is on par with (or better than!) the much more expensive ramen places in the area.

Looked nice from the street so gave it a shot. Felt like they were short-staffed and slammed with Seamless orders because was very difficult to get wait staff's attention and it looked like he was doing double-duty as sushi chef. Guess it came through in the food (a couple sushi rolls, ramen) which was fine but nothing special. Will not be back.

Love the sign outside stating “slow food, slow service” because it is operated by one man that knows what he is doing. The menu is right sized and so are the prices. A great bowl of ramen will run you $14 and it’s loaded with flavor and noodles. The service is simple and humble. Would recommend for a first date or a couples “date spot.” Will 100% be back.

Wonderful service, atmosphere and outstanding food. A Japanese food / Jazz music combo that works surprisingly well. It's the perfect spot to enjoy a relaxed, slow evening with friends. There's no rush, and I love it! If you're all for quick service and plain food as a result, this won't be your thing.

First of all we must make clear that this is a one man show. The owner is also a chef and a waiter. Keep this always in mind! The experience of the chef is obvious and stunning. And the most important, the food. It was an experience itself! Takoyaki melt in my mouth, and tonkotsu was like a warm hug to my stomach.. Friendly service and excellent conditions! If your road comes to Brooklyn, don't miss it. Thank you and see you again!!

This place is a real treasure in the neighborhood.The food is super delicious and made so well.The owner/chef/waiter is super nice and welcoming. One of the best Ramen I ever had.My favorite is the mix of fish and chicken broth.
Almost makes me want to not post review because I want this place all to myself.  Really delicious broth.
Tasty!

Went here for a last minute Saturday night dinner and it was perfect. Amazing food, super friendly and nice waiter, and decent pricing. Highly highly recommend! Will definitely be going back to try more things on the menu :)
Ramen was so heartwarming.
Delicious! Nice owner and staff too.

This place is basically a one man show but all the same he is able to attend to every one and his food is good as well, my only issue is that once I got a beef ramen 🍜 and I absolutely did not enjoy it , I would have given him 5 star ⭐️ .

I really wanted to like Ajihei but I was disappointed... I'm ok with slow service, patience usually pays and I had no rush but it seemed everything was off from the get go. The place seemed like it hadn't been put in order for a long time and the 2 people service (we were 4 customers only) seemed to scramble to get things moving. I stayed cause... Patience pays... Now to the sushi: I ordered omakase and I had high hopes, and all were just average, the tuna even had tissue as if the cut wasn't good. The urchin didn't seem fresh. I just expected much more from this place, the omakase order was very small too, and at this point I didn't want to order more due the price and timing... Better luck another time... One more note, I don't think it's ok to handle fish and use the phone and not wash hands... Everything seemed off.
Really delicious ramen, attentive and friendly service.

Takes a while to be serviced cause its a 1 man show,but the owner/chef has great hospitality and the food is truely amazing. The ramen here is the best by far in all of bushwick (i ususally get tonkotsu). The takoyaki is a great appetizer to get, you wont regret it. It went great with the dry house sake 👍

It is a one man shop. So, louder for the people in the back: have patience, you should expect that your service will take some time. But the food is so good. I had ramen, appetizers, and sushi; all were very well prepared seasoned and cooked. Would totally go again.
Elderly gentleman was waiting tables, and cooking by himself. Does only one person work here on a Sunday night?

/* This Work is Licensed Under the GNU GPL version 3 or later. */  16 July 2018.  I visited this Brooklyn branch of the Princeton NJ restaurant. I found the food nothing extraordinary. I was expecting outstanding flavored ramen with a 4+ stars rating but that was not the case.  Food was competent but not 'Wao! I must return again' inducing.  No Wi-Fi---sigh.
Excellent sushi, delicious ramen, dynamic menu, fair prices, happy hour specials everyday. あじへいは　すばらしいですね！
Food is super fresh, done well, and really reasonable!
This is a small sushi place with delicious fresh sushi, poke bowls,  and pork broth ramen. A good quiet spot for a date or catching up with an old friend.
I had an extraordinary meal here tonight. I've been to nearly every ramen place in the city and this is among the best I've ever had. In fact, it's the best affordable ramen bowl I've ever had.

This unassuming restaurant is not only a good neighborhood sushi place but a truly good Japanese restaurant. The takoyaki was great with nice pieces of octopus inside. The squid legs were simple but crispy and flavorful.  I had at hakkio chirashi for dinner. The fish was tender and delicious. The uni was fresh and plentiful. It was also a treat to get actual Wasabi instead of the he bright green toothpaste at most places in the city. I almost got Ramen as seconds.  People should go here
Great flavors
exceptionally great authentic Japanese place. reminds me of my time in kyoto.
A hidden jem in Bushwick. ask him omakese or try authetic sushi. I have never had that fresh and good sushi in that price in the city
Great food!  Love the crispy fried gyoza.  The two appetizer chicken dishes are perfectly prepared.  Highly recommend!
Terrible service, laughable food
My favorite local joint. Well priced for the quality and reminds me of suburban Japanese restaurants.
Best Ramen I've had in NYC
The ramen is really good and for the vegans vegetable ramen is especially delicious. Sushi is always fresh too. We go here 2-3 times a month!
We were impressed by the quality of the sushi and will definitely be back!
Amazingly authentic Japanense food.
Simply the best ramen you can find around here .. Tokyo style hyper flavorful clear broths!
soy bean not even fresh, ramen also not the best I have.
Best Ramen I've had by far. Soothing, authentic and just plain delicious. Highly recommend!

Excellent quality of Japanese food. The owner is super nice  and he knows his stuff. Great selection of sake and their chirashi sushi is quite fresh. You can also find this store in Princeton. Overall you can't beat the price of this authentic Japanese meal in this area. Highly recommend even if you are outside of Bushwick.
(Translated by Google) Good tonkotsu ramen soup.  (Original) Good tonkotsu ramen soup.
Great little spot!! Fish was fresh and delicious
Great Ramen and Takoyaki. Pork belly could have been better but can't complain with the Free Ramen promo when you order a draft beer and a tapas.
